subject: mirror.inter.net.il and its upstream ftp.uk.d.o (was: Changes in the Israeli mirrors for Debian)
body:
Hello Imri,

On Sun, Jun 10, 2007 at 09:06:24PM +0300, Imri Zvik wrote:
> The mirror has been running for the past month with a more redundant RAID configuration (on expense of storage area, of course :( ).
>  
> 1. The IPv6 addresses will be either removed or utilized by the end of this week.

Good.

> 2. The non-US directories were synced from
> ftp://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/, using the official anonftpsync
> script.

Ok, so that is a issue specific to ftp.uk.d.o, whose admin is in CC.

Phil, could you remove these extra non-us and non-US directories that
are present under http://ftp.uk.debian.org/debian/ ?

> Should I use another upstream server to sync from?

You don't need to change your upstream mirror, unless you find a faster
one for you :-)

Regards,

-- 
Simon Paillard


-- 
To UNSUBSCRIBE, email to debian-mirrors-REQUEST@lists.debian.org
with a subject of "unsubscribe". Trouble? Contact listmaster@lists.debian.org
